data.title: French State Raises Stake in Air France-KLM to Secure Rights
data.meta_description: The French state will increase its stake in national carrier Air France-KLM Group to gain more voting power after making a similar move with Renault SA as it seeks clout over key industries.
data.text:
The French state will increase its stake in national carrier Air France-KLM Group to gain more voting power after making a similar move with Renault SA as it seeks clout over key industries.

The state will buy as many as 5.1 million shares, or 1.7 percent of the stock, for as much as 46 million euros ($51.5 million), raising its stake from the current 15.88 percent, according to the Finance and Economy Ministries in Paris.
